command.description: a Skaffold command for which the profile is auto-activated.
command.x-intellij-html-description: a Skaffold command for which the profile is auto-activated.

env.description: a `key=pattern` pair. The profile is auto-activated if an Environment Variable `key` matches the pattern. If the pattern starts with `!`, activation happens if the remaining pattern is _not_ matched. The pattern matches if the Environment Variable value is exactly `pattern`, or the regex `pattern` is found in it. An empty `pattern` (e.g. `env: "key="`) always only matches if the Environment Variable is undefined or empty.
env.x-intellij-html-description: a key=pattern pair. The profile is auto-activated if an Environment Variable key matches the pattern. If the pattern starts with !, activation happens if the remaining pattern is not matched. The pattern matches if the Environment Variable value is exactly pattern, or the regex pattern is found in it. An empty pattern (e.g. env: "key=") always only matches if the Environment Variable is undefined or empty.

kubeContext.description: a Kubernetes context for which the profile is auto-activated.
kubeContext.x-intellij-html-description: a Kubernetes context for which the profile is auto-activated.

Activation.description: criteria by which a profile is auto-activated.
Activation.x-intellij-html-description: criteria by which a profile is auto-activated.

BuildConfig.description: contains all the configuration for the build steps.
BuildConfig.x-intellij-html-description: contains all the configuration for the build steps.

buildpacks.description: a list of strings, where each string is a specific buildpack to use with the builder. If you specify buildpacks the builder image automatic detection will be ignored. These buildpacks will be used to build the Image from your source code. Order matters.
buildpacks.x-intellij-html-description: a list of strings, where each string is a specific buildpack to use with the builder. If you specify buildpacks the builder image automatic detection will be ignored. These buildpacks will be used to build the Image from your source code. Order matters.

dependencies.description: file dependencies that skaffold should watch for both rebuilding and file syncing for this artifact.
dependencies.x-intellij-html-description: file dependencies that skaffold should watch for both rebuilding and file syncing for this artifact.

env.description: environment variables, in the `key=value` form,  passed to the build. Values can use the go template syntax.
env.x-intellij-html-description: environment variables, in the key=value form, passed to the build. Values can use the go template syntax.

projectDescriptor.description: path to the project descriptor file.
projectDescriptor.x-intellij-html-description: path to the project descriptor file.

runImage.description: overrides the stack's default run image.
runImage.x-intellij-html-description: overrides the stack's default run image.

trustBuilder.description: indicates that the builder should be trusted.
trustBuilder.x-intellij-html-description: indicates that the builder should be trusted.

BuildpackArtifact.x-intellij-html-description: alpha describes an artifact built using Cloud Native Buildpacks. It can be used to build images out of project's sources without any additional configuration.

ignore.description: specifies the paths that should be ignored by skaffold's file watcher. If a file exists in both `paths` and in `ignore`, it will be ignored, and will be excluded from both rebuilds and file synchronization. Will only work in conjunction with `paths`.
ignore.x-intellij-html-description: specifies the paths that should be ignored by skaffold's file watcher. If a file exists in both paths and in ignore, it will be ignored, and will be excluded from both rebuilds and file synchronization. Will only work in conjunction with paths.

paths.description: should be set to the file dependencies for this artifact, so that the skaffold file watcher knows when to rebuild and perform file synchronization.
paths.x-intellij-html-description: should be set to the file dependencies for this artifact, so that the skaffold file watcher knows when to rebuild and perform file synchronization.

BuildpackDependencies.description: *alpha* used to specify dependencies for an artifact built by buildpacks.
BuildpackDependencies.x-intellij-html-description: alpha used to specify dependencies for an artifact built by buildpacks.

annotations.description: describes the Kubernetes annotations for the pod.
annotations.x-intellij-html-description: describes the Kubernetes annotations for the pod.

concurrency.description: how many artifacts can be built concurrently. 0 means "no-limit".
concurrency.x-intellij-html-description: how many artifacts can be built concurrently. 0 means "no-limit".

dockerConfig.description: describes how to mount the local Docker configuration into a pod.
dockerConfig.x-intellij-html-description: describes how to mount the local Docker configuration into a pod.

namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace. Defaults to current namespace in Kubernetes configuration.
namespace.x-intellij-html-description: Kubernetes namespace. Defaults to current namespace in Kubernetes configuration.

pullSecretMountPath.description: path the pull secret will be mounted at within the running container.
pullSecretMountPath.x-intellij-html-description: path the pull secret will be mounted at within the running container.

pullSecretName.description: name of the Kubernetes secret for pulling base images and pushing the final image. If given, the secret needs to contain the Google Cloud service account secret key under the key `kaniko-secret`.
pullSecretName.x-intellij-html-description: name of the Kubernetes secret for pulling base images and pushing the final image. If given, the secret needs to contain the Google Cloud service account secret key under the key kaniko-secret.

pullSecretPath.description: path to the Google Cloud service account secret key file.
pullSecretPath.x-intellij-html-description: path to the Google Cloud service account secret key file.

randomDockerConfigSecret.description: adds a random UUID postfix to the default name of the docker secret to facilitate parallel builds, e.g. docker-cfgfd154022-c761-416f-8eb3-cf8258450b85.
randomDockerConfigSecret.x-intellij-html-description: adds a random UUID postfix to the default name of the docker secret to facilitate parallel builds, e.g. docker-cfgfd154022-c761-416f-8eb3-cf8258450b85.

randomPullSecret.description: adds a random UUID postfix to the default name of the pull secret to facilitate parallel builds, e.g. kaniko-secretdocker-cfgfd154022-c761-416f-8eb3-cf8258450b85.
randomPullSecret.x-intellij-html-description: adds a random UUID postfix to the default name of the pull secret to facilitate parallel builds, e.g. kaniko-secretdocker-cfgfd154022-c761-416f-8eb3-cf8258450b85.

resources.description: define the resource requirements for the kaniko pod.
resources.x-intellij-html-description: define the resource requirements for the kaniko pod.

runAsUser.description: defines the UID to request for running the container. If omitted, no SeurityContext will be specified for the pod and will therefore be inherited from the service account.
runAsUser.x-intellij-html-description: defines the UID to request for running the container. If omitted, no SeurityContext will be specified for the pod and will therefore be inherited from the service account.

serviceAccount.description: describes the Kubernetes service account to use for the pod. Defaults to 'default'.
serviceAccount.x-intellij-html-description: describes the Kubernetes service account to use for the pod. Defaults to 'default'.

timeout.description: amount of time (in seconds) that this build is allowed to run. Defaults to 20 minutes (`20m`).
timeout.x-intellij-html-description: amount of time (in seconds) that this build is allowed to run. Defaults to 20 minutes (20m).

tolerations.x-intellij-html-description: describes the Kubernetes tolerations for the pod.

dependencies.x-intellij-html-description: file dependencies that skaffold should watch for both rebuilding and file syncing for this artifact.

command.x-intellij-html-description: represents a custom command that skaffold executes to obtain dependencies. The output of this command must be a valid JSON array.

ignore.description: specifies the paths that should be ignored by skaffold's file watcher. If a file exists in both `paths` and in `ignore`, it will be ignored, and will be excluded from both rebuilds and file synchronization. Will only work in conjunction with `paths`.
ignore.x-intellij-html-description: specifies the paths that should be ignored by skaffold's file watcher. If a file exists in both paths and in ignore, it will be ignored, and will be excluded from both rebuilds and file synchronization. Will only work in conjunction with paths.

paths.x-intellij-html-description: should be set to the file dependencies for this artifact, so that the skaffold file watcher knows when to rebuild and perform file synchronization.

dockerfile.x-intellij-html-description: locates the Dockerfile relative to workspace.

network.description: passed through to docker and overrides the network configuration of docker builder. If unset, use whatever is configured in the underlying docker daemon. Valid modes are `host`: use the host's networking stack. `bridge`: use the bridged network configuration. `none`: no networking in the container.

noCache.x-intellij-html-description: used to pass in --no-cache to docker build to prevent caching.

DockerArtifact.x-intellij-html-description: describes an artifact built from a Dockerfile, usually using docker build.

prefix.description: adds a fixed prefix to the tag.
prefix.x-intellij-html-description: adds a fixed prefix to the tag.

variant.description: determines the behavior of the git tagger. Valid variants are: `Tags` (default): use git tags or fall back to abbreviated commit hash. `CommitSha`: use the full git commit sha. `AbbrevCommitSha`: use the abbreviated git commit sha. `TreeSha`: use the full tree hash of the artifact workingdir. `AbbrevTreeSha`: use the abbreviated tree hash of the artifact workingdir.
variant.x-intellij-html-description: determines the behavior of the git tagger. Valid variants are: Tags (default): use git tags or fall back to abbreviated commit hash. CommitSha: use the full git commit sha. AbbrevCommitSha: use the abbreviated git commit sha. TreeSha: use the full tree hash of the artifact workingdir. AbbrevTreeSha: use the abbreviated tree hash of the artifact workingdir.

GitTagger.description: *beta* tags images with the git tag or commit of the artifact's workspace.
GitTagger.x-intellij-html-description: beta tags images with the git tag or commit of the artifact's workspace.

concurrency.description: how many artifacts can be built concurrently. 0 means "no-limit".
concurrency.x-intellij-html-description: how many artifacts can be built concurrently. 0 means "no-limit".

diskSizeGb.description: disk size of the VM that runs the build. See [Cloud Build Reference](https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/api/reference/rest/v1/projects.builds#buildoptions).
diskSizeGb.x-intellij-html-description: disk size of the VM that runs the build. See Cloud Build Reference.

dockerImage.description: image that runs a Docker build. See [Cloud Builders](https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/cloud-builders).
dockerImage.x-intellij-html-description: image that runs a Docker build. See Cloud Builders.

gradleImage.description: image that runs a Gradle build. See [Cloud Builders](https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/cloud-builders).
gradleImage.x-intellij-html-description: image that runs a Gradle build. See Cloud Builders.

kanikoImage.x-intellij-html-description: image that runs a Kaniko build. See Cloud Builders.

logStreamingOption.description: specifies the behavior when writing build logs to Google Cloud Storage. Valid options are: `STREAM_DEFAULT`: Service may automatically determine build log streaming behavior. `STREAM_ON`:  Build logs should be streamed to Google Cloud Storage. `STREAM_OFF`: Build logs should not be streamed to Google Cloud Storage; they will be written when the build is completed. See [Cloud Build Reference](https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/api/reference/rest/v1/projects.builds#logstreamingoption).
logStreamingOption.x-intellij-html-description: specifies the behavior when writing build logs to Google Cloud Storage. Valid options are: STREAM_DEFAULT: Service may automatically determine build log streaming behavior. STREAM_ON: Build logs should be streamed to Google Cloud Storage. STREAM_OFF: Build logs should not be streamed to Google Cloud Storage; they will be written when the build is completed. See Cloud Build Reference.

logging.description: specifies the logging mode. Valid modes are: `LOGGING_UNSPECIFIED`: The service determines the logging mode. `LEGACY`: Stackdriver logging and Cloud Storage logging are enabled (default). `GCS_ONLY`: Only Cloud Storage logging is enabled. See [Cloud Build Reference](https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/api/reference/rest/v1/projects.builds#loggingmode).
logging.x-intellij-html-description: specifies the logging mode. Valid modes are: LOGGING_UNSPECIFIED: The service determines the logging mode. LEGACY: Stackdriver logging and Cloud Storage logging are enabled (default). GCS_ONLY: Only Cloud Storage logging is enabled. See Cloud Build Reference.

machineType.description: type of the VM that runs the build. See [Cloud Build Reference](https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/api/reference/rest/v1/projects.builds#buildoptions).
machineType.x-intellij-html-description: type of the VM that runs the build. See Cloud Build Reference.

mavenImage.description: image that runs a Maven build. See [Cloud Builders](https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/cloud-builders).
mavenImage.x-intellij-html-description: image that runs a Maven build. See Cloud Builders.

packImage.description: image that runs a Cloud Native Buildpacks build. See [Cloud Builders](https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/cloud-builders).
packImage.x-intellij-html-description: image that runs a Cloud Native Buildpacks build. See Cloud Builders.

projectId.description: ID of your Cloud Platform Project. If it is not provided, Skaffold will guess it from the image name. For example, given the artifact image name `gcr.io/myproject/image`, Skaffold will use the `myproject` GCP project.
projectId.x-intellij-html-description: ID of your Cloud Platform Project. If it is not provided, Skaffold will guess it from the image name. For example, given the artifact image name gcr.io/myproject/image, Skaffold will use the myproject GCP project.

timeout.description: amount of time (in seconds) that this build should be allowed to run. See [Cloud Build Reference](https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/api/reference/rest/v1/projects.builds#resource-build).
timeout.x-intellij-html-description: amount of time (in seconds) that this build should be allowed to run. See Cloud Build Reference.

workerPool.description: configures a pool of workers to run the build.
workerPool.x-intellij-html-description: configures a pool of workers to run the build.

GoogleCloudBuild.description: *beta* describes how to do a remote build on [Google Cloud Build](https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/). Docker and Jib artifacts can be built on Cloud Build. The `projectId` needs to be provided and the currently logged in user should be given permissions to trigger new builds.
GoogleCloudBuild.x-intellij-html-description: beta describes how to do a remote build on Google Cloud Build. Docker and Jib artifacts can be built on Cloud Build. The projectId needs to be provided and the currently logged in user should be given permissions to trigger new builds.

explicitRegistry.description: separates `image.registry` to the image config syntax. Useful for some charts e.g. `postgresql`.
explicitRegistry.x-intellij-html-description: separates image.registry to the image config syntax. Useful for some charts e.g. postgresql.

HelmConventionConfig.description: image config in the syntax of image.repository and image.tag.
HelmConventionConfig.x-intellij-html-description: image config in the syntax of image.repository and image.tag.

flags.description: additional option flags that are passed on the command line to `helm`.
flags.x-intellij-html-description: additional option flags that are passed on the command line to helm.

HelmDeploy.description: *beta* uses the `helm` CLI to apply the charts to the cluster.
HelmDeploy.x-intellij-html-description: beta uses the helm CLI to apply the charts to the cluster.

global.description: additional flags passed on every command.
global.x-intellij-html-description: additional flags passed on every command.

HelmDeployFlags.description: additional option flags that are passed on the command line to `helm`.
HelmDeployFlags.x-intellij-html-description: additional option flags that are passed on the command line to helm.

HelmFQNConfig.description: image config to use the FullyQualifiedImageName as param to set.
HelmFQNConfig.x-intellij-html-description: image config to use the FullyQualifiedImageName as param to set.

helm.description: image configuration uses the syntax `IMAGE-NAME.repository=IMAGE-REPOSITORY, IMAGE-NAME.tag=IMAGE-TAG`.
helm.x-intellij-html-description: image configuration uses the syntax IMAGE-NAME.repository=IMAGE-REPOSITORY, IMAGE-NAME.tag=IMAGE-TAG.

HelmImageStrategy.description: adds image configurations to the Helm `values` file.
HelmImageStrategy.x-intellij-html-description: adds image configurations to the Helm values file.

appVersion.description: sets the `appVersion` on the chart to this version.
appVersion.x-intellij-html-description: sets the appVersion on the chart to this version.

version.description: sets the `version` on the chart to this semver version.
version.x-intellij-html-description: sets the version on the chart to this semver version.

HelmPackaged.description: parameters for packaging helm chart (`helm package`).
HelmPackaged.x-intellij-html-description: parameters for packaging helm chart (helm package).

artifactOverrides.description: key value pairs where the key represents the parameter used in the `--set-string` Helm CLI flag to define a container image and the value corresponds to artifact i.e. `ImageName` defined in `Build.Artifacts` section. The resulting command-line is controlled by `ImageStrategy`.
artifactOverrides.x-intellij-html-description: key value pairs where the key represents the parameter used in the --set-string Helm CLI flag to define a container image and the value corresponds to artifact i.e. ImageName defined in Build.Artifacts section. The resulting command-line is controlled by ImageStrategy.

createNamespace.description: if `true`, Skaffold will send `--create-namespace` flag to Helm CLI. `--create-namespace` flag is available in Helm since version 3.2. Defaults is `false`.
createNamespace.x-intellij-html-description: if true, Skaffold will send --create-namespace flag to Helm CLI. --create-namespace flag is available in Helm since version 3.2. Defaults is false.

imageStrategy.description: controls how an `ArtifactOverrides` entry is turned into `--set-string` Helm CLI flag or flags.
imageStrategy.x-intellij-html-description: controls how an ArtifactOverrides entry is turned into --set-string Helm CLI flag or flags.

overrides.description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will build a Helm `values` file that overrides the original and use it to call Helm CLI (`--f` flag).
overrides.x-intellij-html-description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will build a Helm values file that overrides the original and use it to call Helm CLI (--f flag).

packaged.description: parameters for packaging helm chart (`helm package`).
packaged.x-intellij-html-description: parameters for packaging helm chart (helm package).

recreatePods.description: if `true`, Skaffold will send `--recreate-pods` flag to Helm CLI when upgrading a new version of a chart in subsequent dev loop deploy.
recreatePods.x-intellij-html-description: if true, Skaffold will send --recreate-pods flag to Helm CLI when upgrading a new version of a chart in subsequent dev loop deploy.

remote.description: specifies whether the chart path is remote, or exists on the host filesystem.
remote.x-intellij-html-description: specifies whether the chart path is remote, or exists on the host filesystem.

setFiles.description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will send `--set-file` flag to Helm CLI and append all pairs after the flag.
setFiles.x-intellij-html-description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will send --set-file flag to Helm CLI and append all pairs after the flag.

setValueTemplates.description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will try to parse the value part of each key-value pair using environment variables in the system, then send `--set` flag to Helm CLI and append all parsed pairs after the flag.
setValueTemplates.x-intellij-html-description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will try to parse the value part of each key-value pair using environment variables in the system, then send --set flag to Helm CLI and append all parsed pairs after the flag.

setValues.description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will send `--set` flag to Helm CLI and append all pairs after the flag.
setValues.x-intellij-html-description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will send --set flag to Helm CLI and append all pairs after the flag.

skipBuildDependencies.description: should build dependencies be skipped. Ignored when `remote: true`.
skipBuildDependencies.x-intellij-html-description: should build dependencies be skipped. Ignored when remote: true.

upgradeOnChange.description: specifies whether to upgrade helm chart on code changes. Default is `true` when helm chart is local (`remote: false`). Default is `false` if `remote: true`.
upgradeOnChange.x-intellij-html-description: specifies whether to upgrade helm chart on code changes. Default is true when helm chart is local (remote: false). Default is false if remote: true.

useHelmSecrets.description: instructs skaffold to use secrets plugin on deployment.
useHelmSecrets.x-intellij-html-description: instructs skaffold to use secrets plugin on deployment.

wait.description: if `true`, Skaffold will send `--wait` flag to Helm CLI.
wait.x-intellij-html-description: if true, Skaffold will send --wait flag to Helm CLI.

HelmRelease.description: describes a helm release to be deployed.
HelmRelease.x-intellij-html-description: describes a helm release to be deployed.

from.description: source position in the yaml, used for `copy` or `move` operations.
from.x-intellij-html-description: source position in the yaml, used for copy or move operations.

op.description: operation carried by the patch: `add`, `remove`, `replace`, `move`, `copy` or `test`.
op.x-intellij-html-description: operation carried by the patch: add, remove, replace, move, copy or test.

path.description: position in the yaml where the operation takes place. For example, this targets the `dockerfile` of the first artifact built.
path.x-intellij-html-description: position in the yaml where the operation takes place. For example, this targets the dockerfile of the first artifact built.

value.description: value to apply. Can be any portion of yaml.
value.x-intellij-html-description: value to apply. Can be any portion of yaml.

JSONPatch.description: patch to be applied by a profile.
JSONPatch.x-intellij-html-description: patch to be applied by a profile.

args.description: additional build flags passed to the builder.
args.x-intellij-html-description: additional build flags passed to the builder.

fromImage.description: overrides the configured jib base image.
fromImage.x-intellij-html-description: overrides the configured jib base image.

project.description: selects which sub-project to build for multi-module builds.
project.x-intellij-html-description: selects which sub-project to build for multi-module builds.

type.description: the Jib builder type; normally determined automatically. Valid types are `maven`: for Maven. `gradle`: for Gradle.
type.x-intellij-html-description: the Jib builder type; normally determined automatically. Valid types are maven: for Maven. gradle: for Gradle.

JibArtifact.description: builds images using the [Jib plugins for Maven and Gradle](https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/jib/).
JibArtifact.x-intellij-html-description: builds images using the Jib plugins for Maven and Gradle.

buildArgs.description: arguments passed to the docker build. It also accepts environment variables and generated values via the go template syntax. Exposed generated values: IMAGE_REPO, IMAGE_NAME, IMAGE_TAG.
buildArgs.x-intellij-html-description: arguments passed to the docker build. It also accepts environment variables and generated values via the go template syntax. Exposed generated values: IMAGEREPO, IMAGENAME, IMAGE_TAG.

cache.description: configures Kaniko caching. If a cache is specified, Kaniko will use a remote cache which will speed up builds.
cache.x-intellij-html-description: configures Kaniko caching. If a cache is specified, Kaniko will use a remote cache which will speed up builds.

cleanup.description: to clean the filesystem at the end of the build.
cleanup.x-intellij-html-description: to clean the filesystem at the end of the build.

digestFile.description: to specify a file in the container. This file will receive the digest of a built image. This can be used to automatically track the exact image built by kaniko.
digestFile.x-intellij-html-description: to specify a file in the container. This file will receive the digest of a built image. This can be used to automatically track the exact image built by kaniko.

dockerfile.description: locates the Dockerfile relative to workspace.
dockerfile.x-intellij-html-description: locates the Dockerfile relative to workspace.

env.description: environment variables passed to the kaniko pod. It also accepts environment variables via the go template syntax.
env.x-intellij-html-description: environment variables passed to the kaniko pod. It also accepts environment variables via the go template syntax.

image.description: Docker image used by the Kaniko pod. Defaults to the latest released version of `gcr.io/kaniko-project/executor`.
image.x-intellij-html-description: Docker image used by the Kaniko pod. Defaults to the latest released version of gcr.io/kaniko-project/executor.

imageNameWithDigestFile.description: specify a file to save the image name with digest of the built image to.
imageNameWithDigestFile.x-intellij-html-description: specify a file to save the image name with digest of the built image to.

initImage.description: image used to run init container which mounts kaniko context.
initImage.x-intellij-html-description: image used to run init container which mounts kaniko context.

insecure.description: if you want to push images to a plain HTTP registry.
insecure.x-intellij-html-description: if you want to push images to a plain HTTP registry.

insecurePull.description: if you want to pull images from a plain HTTP registry.
insecurePull.x-intellij-html-description: if you want to pull images from a plain HTTP registry.

insecureRegistry.description: to use plain HTTP requests when accessing a registry.
insecureRegistry.x-intellij-html-description: to use plain HTTP requests when accessing a registry.

label.description: key: value to set some metadata to the final image. This is equivalent as using the LABEL within the Dockerfile.
label.x-intellij-html-description: key: value to set some metadata to the final image. This is equivalent as using the LABEL within the Dockerfile.

logTimestamp.description: to add timestamps to log format.
logTimestamp.x-intellij-html-description: to add timestamps to log format.

noPush.description: if you only want to build the image, without pushing to a registry.
noPush.x-intellij-html-description: if you only want to build the image, without pushing to a registry.

ociLayoutPath.description: to specify a directory in the container where the OCI image layout of a built image will be placed. This can be used to automatically track the exact image built by kaniko.
ociLayoutPath.x-intellij-html-description: to specify a directory in the container where the OCI image layout of a built image will be placed. This can be used to automatically track the exact image built by kaniko.

registryCertificate.description: to provide a certificate for TLS communication with a given registry. my.registry.url: /path/to/the/certificate.cert is the expected format.
registryCertificate.x-intellij-html-description: to provide a certificate for TLS communication with a given registry. my.registry.url: /path/to/the/certificate.cert is the expected format.

registryMirror.description: if you want to use a registry mirror instead of default `index.docker.io`.
registryMirror.x-intellij-html-description: if you want to use a registry mirror instead of default index.docker.io.

reproducible.description: used to strip timestamps out of the built image.
reproducible.x-intellij-html-description: used to strip timestamps out of the built image.

singleSnapshot.description: takes a single snapshot of the filesystem at the end of the build. So only one layer will be appended to the base image.
singleSnapshot.x-intellij-html-description: takes a single snapshot of the filesystem at the end of the build. So only one layer will be appended to the base image.

skipTLS.description: skips TLS certificate validation when pushing to a registry.
skipTLS.x-intellij-html-description: skips TLS certificate validation when pushing to a registry.

skipTLSVerifyPull.description: skips TLS certificate validation when pulling from a registry.
skipTLSVerifyPull.x-intellij-html-description: skips TLS certificate validation when pulling from a registry.

skipTLSVerifyRegistry.description: skips TLS certificate validation when accessing a registry.
skipTLSVerifyRegistry.x-intellij-html-description: skips TLS certificate validation when accessing a registry.

skipUnusedStages.description: builds only used stages if defined to true. Otherwise it builds by default all stages, even the unnecessaries ones until it reaches the target stage / end of Dockerfile.
skipUnusedStages.x-intellij-html-description: builds only used stages if defined to true. Otherwise it builds by default all stages, even the unnecessaries ones until it reaches the target stage / end of Dockerfile.

snapshotMode.description: how Kaniko will snapshot the filesystem.
snapshotMode.x-intellij-html-description: how Kaniko will snapshot the filesystem.

tarPath.description: path to save the image as a tarball at path instead of pushing the image.
tarPath.x-intellij-html-description: path to save the image as a tarball at path instead of pushing the image.

target.description: to indicate which build stage is the target build stage.
target.x-intellij-html-description: to indicate which build stage is the target build stage.

useNewRun.description: to Use the experimental run implementation for detecting changes without requiring file system snapshots. In some cases, this may improve build performance by 75%.
useNewRun.x-intellij-html-description: to Use the experimental run implementation for detecting changes without requiring file system snapshots. In some cases, this may improve build performance by 75%.

volumeMounts.description: volume mounts passed to kaniko pod.
volumeMounts.x-intellij-html-description: volume mounts passed to kaniko pod.

whitelistVarRun.description: used to ignore `/var/run` when taking image snapshot. Set it to false to preserve /var/run/* in destination image.
whitelistVarRun.x-intellij-html-description: used to ignore /var/run when taking image snapshot. Set it to false to preserve /var/run/* in destination image.

KanikoArtifact.description: describes an artifact built from a Dockerfile, with kaniko.
KanikoArtifact.x-intellij-html-description: describes an artifact built from a Dockerfile, with kaniko.

hostPath.description: specifies a path on the host that is mounted to each pod as read only cache volume containing base images. If set, must exist on each node and prepopulated with kaniko-warmer.
hostPath.x-intellij-html-description: specifies a path on the host that is mounted to each pod as read only cache volume containing base images. If set, must exist on each node and prepopulated with kaniko-warmer.

repo.description: a remote repository to store cached layers. If none is specified, one will be inferred from the image name. See [Kaniko Caching](https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/kaniko#caching).
repo.x-intellij-html-description: a remote repository to store cached layers. If none is specified, one will be inferred from the image name. See Kaniko Caching.

KanikoCache.description: configures Kaniko caching. If a cache is specified, Kaniko will use a remote cache which will speed up builds.
KanikoCache.x-intellij-html-description: configures Kaniko caching. If a cache is specified, Kaniko will use a remote cache which will speed up builds.

dir.description: equivalent to the dir in `kpt live apply <dir>`. If not provided, kpt deployer will create a hidden directory `.kpt-hydrated` to store the manipulated resource output and the kpt inventory-template.yaml file.
dir.x-intellij-html-description: equivalent to the dir in kpt live apply <dir>. If not provided, kpt deployer will create a hidden directory .kpt-hydrated to store the manipulated resource output and the kpt inventory-template.yaml file.

inventoryID.x-intellij-html-description: alpha identifier for a group of applied resources. This value is only needed when the kpt live is working on a pre-applied cluster resources.

pollPeriod.description: sets for the polling period for resource statuses. Default to 2s.
pollPeriod.x-intellij-html-description: sets for the polling period for resource statuses. Default to 2s.

prunePropagationPolicy.description: sets the propagation policy for pruning. Possible settings are Background, Foreground, Orphan. Default to "Background".
prunePropagationPolicy.x-intellij-html-description: sets the propagation policy for pruning. Possible settings are Background, Foreground, Orphan. Default to "Background".

pruneTimeout.description: sets the time threshold to wait for all pruned resources to be deleted.
pruneTimeout.x-intellij-html-description: sets the time threshold to wait for all pruned resources to be deleted.

reconcileTimeout.description: sets the time threshold to wait for all resources to reach the current status.
reconcileTimeout.x-intellij-html-description: sets the time threshold to wait for all resources to reach the current status.

KptApplyOptions.description: adds additional configurations used when calling `kpt live apply`.
KptApplyOptions.x-intellij-html-description: adds additional configurations used when calling kpt live apply.

dir.description: path to the config directory (Required). By default, the Dir contains the application configurations, [kustomize config files](https://kubectl.docs.kubernetes.io/pages/examples/kustomize.html) and [declarative kpt functions](https://googlecontainertools.github.io/kpt/guides/consumer/function/#declarative-run).
dir.x-intellij-html-description: path to the config directory (Required). By default, the Dir contains the application configurations, kustomize config files and declarative kpt functions.

KptDeploy.description: *alpha* uses the `kpt` CLI to manage and deploy manifests.
KptDeploy.x-intellij-html-description: alpha uses the kpt CLI to manage and deploy manifests.

fnPath.description: directory to discover the declarative kpt functions. If not provided, kpt deployer uses `kpt.Dir`.
fnPath.x-intellij-html-description: directory to discover the declarative kpt functions. If not provided, kpt deployer uses kpt.Dir.

globalScope.description: sets the global scope for the kpt functions. see `kpt help fn run`.
globalScope.x-intellij-html-description: sets the global scope for the kpt functions. see kpt help fn run.

image.description: a kpt function image to run the configs imperatively. If provided, kpt.fn.fnPath will be ignored.
image.x-intellij-html-description: a kpt function image to run the configs imperatively. If provided, kpt.fn.fnPath will be ignored.

mount.description: a list of storage options to mount to the fn image.
mount.x-intellij-html-description: a list of storage options to mount to the fn image.

network.description: enables network access for the kpt function containers.
network.x-intellij-html-description: enables network access for the kpt function containers.

networkName.description: docker network name to run the kpt function containers (default "bridge").
networkName.x-intellij-html-description: docker network name to run the kpt function containers (default "bridge").

sinkDir.description: directory to where the manipulated resource output is stored.
sinkDir.x-intellij-html-description: directory to where the manipulated resource output is stored.

KptFn.description: adds additional configurations used when calling `kpt fn`.
KptFn.x-intellij-html-description: adds additional configurations used when calling kpt fn.

options.description: adds additional configurations for `kpt live apply` commands.
options.x-intellij-html-description: adds additional configurations for kpt live apply commands.

KptLive.description: adds additional configurations used when calling `kpt live`.
KptLive.x-intellij-html-description: adds additional configurations used when calling kpt live.

defaultNamespace.description: default namespace passed to kubectl on deployment if no other override is given.
defaultNamespace.x-intellij-html-description: default namespace passed to kubectl on deployment if no other override is given.

manifests.description: the Kubernetes yaml or json manifests.
manifests.x-intellij-html-description: the Kubernetes yaml or json manifests.

KubectlDeploy.x-intellij-html-description: beta uses a client side kubectl apply to deploy manifests. You'll need a kubectl CLI version installed that's compatible with your cluster.

apply.description: additional flags passed on creations (`kubectl apply`).
apply.x-intellij-html-description: additional flags passed on creations (kubectl apply).

delete.description: additional flags passed on deletions (`kubectl delete`).
delete.x-intellij-html-description: additional flags passed on deletions (kubectl delete).

disableValidation.description: passes the `--validate=false` flag to supported `kubectl` commands when enabled.
disableValidation.x-intellij-html-description: passes the --validate=false flag to supported kubectl commands when enabled.

global.description: additional flags passed on every command.
global.x-intellij-html-description: additional flags passed on every command.

KubectlFlags.description: additional flags passed on the command line to kubectl either on every command (Global), on creations (Apply) or deletions (Delete).
KubectlFlags.x-intellij-html-description: additional flags passed on the command line to kubectl either on every command (Global), on creations (Apply) or deletions (Delete).

concurrency.description: how many artifacts can be built concurrently. 0 means "no-limit".
concurrency.x-intellij-html-description: how many artifacts can be built concurrently. 0 means "no-limit".

push.description: should images be pushed to a registry. If not specified, images are pushed only if the current Kubernetes context connects to a remote cluster.
push.x-intellij-html-description: should images be pushed to a registry. If not specified, images are pushed only if the current Kubernetes context connects to a remote cluster.

useDockerCLI.description: use `docker` command-line interface instead of Docker Engine APIs.
useDockerCLI.x-intellij-html-description: use docker command-line interface instead of Docker Engine APIs.

LocalBuild.description: *beta* describes how to do a build on the local docker daemon and optionally push to a repository.
LocalBuild.x-intellij-html-description: beta describes how to do a build on the local docker daemon and optionally push to a repository.

prefix.description: defines the prefix shown on each log line. Valid values are `container`: prefix logs lines with the name of the container. `podAndContainer`: prefix logs lines with the names of the pod and of the container. `auto`: same as `podAndContainer` except that the pod name is skipped if it's the same as the container name. `none`: don't add a prefix.
prefix.x-intellij-html-description: defines the prefix shown on each log line. Valid values are container: prefix logs lines with the name of the container. podAndContainer: prefix logs lines with the names of the pod and of the container. auto: same as podAndContainer except that the pod name is skipped if it's the same as the container name. none: don't add a prefix.

LogsConfig.description: configures how container logs are printed as a result of a deployment.
LogsConfig.x-intellij-html-description: configures how container logs are printed as a result of a deployment.

Metadata.description: holds an optional name of the project.
Metadata.x-intellij-html-description: holds an optional name of the project.

address.description: local address to bind to. Defaults to the loopback address 127.0.0.1.
address.x-intellij-html-description: local address to bind to. Defaults to the loopback address 127.0.0.1.

localPort.description: local port to forward to. If the port is unavailable, Skaffold will choose a random open port to forward to. *Optional*.
localPort.x-intellij-html-description: local port to forward to. If the port is unavailable, Skaffold will choose a random open port to forward to. Optional.

namespace.description: namespace of the resource to port forward.
namespace.x-intellij-html-description: namespace of the resource to port forward.

port.description: resource port that will be forwarded.
port.x-intellij-html-description: resource port that will be forwarded.

resourceName.description: name of the Kubernetes resource to port forward.
resourceName.x-intellij-html-description: name of the Kubernetes resource to port forward.

resourceType.description: Kubernetes type that should be port forwarded. Acceptable resource types include: `Service`, `Pod` and Controller resource type that has a pod spec: `ReplicaSet`, `ReplicationController`, `Deployment`, `StatefulSet`, `DaemonSet`, `Job`, `CronJob`.
resourceType.x-intellij-html-description: Kubernetes type that should be port forwarded. Acceptable resource types include: Service, Pod and Controller resource type that has a pod spec: ReplicaSet, ReplicationController, Deployment, StatefulSet, DaemonSet, Job, CronJob.

PortForwardResource.description: describes a resource to port forward.
PortForwardResource.x-intellij-html-description: describes a resource to port forward.

activation.description: criteria by which a profile can be auto-activated. The profile is auto-activated if any one of the activations are triggered. An activation is triggered if all of the criteria (env, kubeContext, command) are triggered.
activation.x-intellij-html-description: criteria by which a profile can be auto-activated. The profile is auto-activated if any one of the activations are triggered. An activation is triggered if all of the criteria (env, kubeContext, command) are triggered.

patches.description: patches applied to the configuration. Patches use the JSON patch notation.
patches.x-intellij-html-description: patches applied to the configuration. Patches use the JSON patch notation.

portForward.description: describes user defined resources to port-forward.
portForward.x-intellij-html-description: describes user defined resources to port-forward.

Profile.description: used to override any `build`, `test` or `deploy` configuration.
Profile.x-intellij-html-description: used to override any build, test or deploy configuration.

cpu.description: the number cores to be used.
cpu.x-intellij-html-description: the number cores to be used.

ephemeralStorage.description: the amount of Ephemeral storage to allocate to the pod.
ephemeralStorage.x-intellij-html-description: the amount of Ephemeral storage to allocate to the pod.

memory.description: the amount of memory to allocate to the pod.
memory.x-intellij-html-description: the amount of memory to allocate to the pod.

resourceStorage.description: the amount of resource storage to allocate to the pod.
resourceStorage.x-intellij-html-description: the amount of resource storage to allocate to the pod.

ResourceRequirement.description: stores the CPU/Memory requirements for the pod.
ResourceRequirement.x-intellij-html-description: stores the CPU/Memory requirements for the pod.

ResourceRequirements.description: describes the resource requirements for the kaniko pod.
ResourceRequirements.x-intellij-html-description: describes the resource requirements for the kaniko pod.

ResourceType.description: describes the Kubernetes resource types used for port forwarding.
ResourceType.x-intellij-html-description: describes the Kubernetes resource types used for port forwarding.

ShaTagger.description: *beta* tags images with their sha256 digest.
ShaTagger.x-intellij-html-description: beta tags images with their sha256 digest.

metadata.description: holds additional information about the config.
metadata.x-intellij-html-description: holds additional information about the config.

portForward.description: describes user defined resources to port-forward.
portForward.x-intellij-html-description: describes user defined resources to port-forward.

profiles.description: *beta* can override be used to `build`, `test` or `deploy` configuration.
profiles.x-intellij-html-description: beta can override be used to build, test or deploy configuration.

SkaffoldConfig.description: holds the fields parsed from the Skaffold configuration file (skaffold.yaml).
SkaffoldConfig.x-intellij-html-description: holds the fields parsed from the Skaffold configuration file (skaffold.yaml).

auto.description: delegates discovery of sync rules to the build system. Only available for jib and buildpacks.
auto.x-intellij-html-description: delegates discovery of sync rules to the build system. Only available for jib and buildpacks.

infer.description: file patterns which may be synced into the container The container destination is inferred by the builder based on the instructions of a Dockerfile. Available for docker and kaniko artifacts and custom artifacts that declare dependencies on a dockerfile.
infer.x-intellij-html-description: file patterns which may be synced into the container The container destination is inferred by the builder based on the instructions of a Dockerfile. Available for docker and kaniko artifacts and custom artifacts that declare dependencies on a dockerfile.

manual.description: manual sync rules indicating the source and destination.
manual.x-intellij-html-description: manual sync rules indicating the source and destination.

Sync.description: *beta* specifies what files to sync into the container. This is a list of sync rules indicating the intent to sync for source files. If no files are listed, sync all the files and infer the destination.
Sync.x-intellij-html-description: beta specifies what files to sync into the container. This is a list of sync rules indicating the intent to sync for source files. If no files are listed, sync all the files and infer the destination.

dest.description: destination path in the container where the files should be synced to.
dest.x-intellij-html-description: destination path in the container where the files should be synced to.

src.description: a glob pattern to match local paths against. Directories should be delimited by `/` on all platforms.
src.x-intellij-html-description: a glob pattern to match local paths against. Directories should be delimited by / on all platforms.

strip.description: specifies the path prefix to remove from the source path when transplanting the files into the destination folder.
strip.x-intellij-html-description: specifies the path prefix to remove from the source path when transplanting the files into the destination folder.

SyncRule.description: specifies which local files to sync to remote folders.
SyncRule.x-intellij-html-description: specifies which local files to sync to remote folders.

customTemplate.x-intellij-html-description: beta tags images with a configurable template string composed of other taggers.

dateTime.description: *beta* tags images with the build timestamp.
dateTime.x-intellij-html-description: beta tags images with the build timestamp.

envTemplate.description: *beta* tags images with a configurable template string.
envTemplate.x-intellij-html-description: beta tags images with a configurable template string.
